item.title: Extending a model of an engine
item.description: Sometimes you may need to add an instance_method, include a concern or do any enhancement to your Rails application model which is originally defined in an engine. As you may know Ruby provides open classes(Which I find very interesting). A solution to easily extent already defined class just by redefining (I can't find a better word) them. You can read more about open classes here.

item.title: Rapid Prototyping by Faalis
item.description: If you are familiar with Ruby on Rails or using it, you are my audience. There are some boring tasks in each web application project which you have to take care of, even if you don't like it. For example: creating an authentication and authorization system, creating an administration interface, building a RESTful api, etc. You may re-implement these systems each time in each project of yours. Isn't it a bit boring and troublesome ?

item.title: Second release candidate of Djamo is out
item.description: Second release candidate of Djamo. Djamo is another MongoDB driver (ORM-like driver) which I was working on. It's very easy to use and have very flexible approach to data management that is more like the way MongoDB works, unlike other ORM-like drivers that try to be more like ORMs of an RDMS by providing an API close to some ORMs.

item.title: A better i18n system for Ruby on Rails
item.description: I never created any multi-language web application using Ruby on Rails, But about a month ago I have to use the Rails i18n system with one of my projects. I had the basic knowledge about how Rails i18n works.
